author: snow7880
content: hi all, would a Chuwi Larkbox be enough for Eth staking? It has a Celeron J4115, 6GB of RAM and M2 storage

author: protolambda
content: <@!161412259724263424> That should be enough for phase 0 validator work, give it a try on Onyx testnet. https://prylabs.net/

author: snow7880
content: I have ordered one and it is estimated to arrive in august

author: snow7880
content: i will try it with testnet

author: settler0010025
content: Hi guys, is it smart for a noob to start validating on Altona when itâ€™s rolled out soon or better to get on an existing testnet first?

author: protolambda
content: <@!161412259724263424> I recommend the prylabs discord, they have more users running on all kinds of machines, they can answer your question better. Here's a link: https://discord.gg/RhNx7wZ

author: protolambda
content: <@!518551371176345610> the Onyx testnet is already up if you want to try Prysm. Altona will be launched later, estimates are end this week, but not clear yet.

author: djrtwo
content: I would wait to run altona next week at this point

author: jgm
content:
Might want to tidy up the messages in the repo linked to in the latest blog post:

> To avoid any shred of doubt in the safety of this _critical_ contract, we recommend using the new Solidity contract for eth2 mainnet

_checks linked repo:_

> **THIS IS NOT THE OFFICIAL DEPOSIT CONTRACT. NOT SUITABLE FOR ANY USE**

author: djrtwo
content: the plan is to port to spec repo soon, but will fix that immediately

author: jgm
content: Seems like it uses about 25% of the gas of the vyper contract, which is nice.

author: djrtwo
content:
> Seems like it uses about 25% of the gas of the vyper contract, which is nice.
yes! I'd be happy even if it were at parity, but the reduction here is really nice

content: The formal verification report has a table of min and max gas costs
